title: Cyber bullying : common types of bullying 2019 , by gender
summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of students on the Y-axis for 4 different Responses for 2 groups Male, and Female that are presented on the X-axis.

Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) had the maximum Share of students among all 2 groups, and it was for Female. The minimum Share of students was observed in Response I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days) for Female.

Among all the Responses, Male had the highest Share of students in Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) and lowest Share of students in Response I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days).
Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) and I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days) had the biggest gap of 260.0 between the highest and lowest Share of students found for Male.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 4 different Responses on X-axis for 2 groups Male, and Female. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of students.

Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) had the maximum Share of students among all 2 groups, and it was for Female. The minimum Share of students was observed in Response I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days) for Female.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of students on the Y-axis for 4 different Responses for 2 groups Male, and Female that are presented on the X-axis.

Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) had the maximum Share of students among all 2 groups, and it was for Female. The minimum Share of students was observed in Response I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days) for Female.

Among all the Responses, Male had the highest Share of students in Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) and lowest Share of students in Response I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days).
Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) and I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days) had the biggest gap of 260.0 between the highest and lowest Share of students found for Male.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of students on the Y-axis for 4 different Responses for 2 groups Male, and Female that are presented on the X-axis.

Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) had the maximum Share of students among all 2 groups, and it was for Female. The minimum Share of students was observed in Response I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days) for Female.

Among all the Responses, Male had the highest Share of students 341.0 in Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) and lowest value 81.0 in Response I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days).
There is a gap of 260.0 between the highest and lowest Share of students found for Male in Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) and I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days).
Out of all 2 groups, the highest gap between the maximum and minimum Share of students was found in case of Male.

On average, the Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) had the highest Share of students for all 2 groups Male, and Female. Whereas I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days) had the lowest average Share of students.
